conversion_verification.notes: The second image shows extruded walls with thickness and interior cutaway; however the camera is only mildly angled and reads close to a top-down view.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Walls are clearly extruded with thickness and clean corners; interior is visible via cutaway. Main weakness is the near-orthographic/top-down viewpoint, which limits perception of vertical wall faces and volume.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint and room adjacencies match the 2D plan (kitchen top-center, dining top-left, living right, bedroom bottom-left, toilet/wash core, stair zone bottom-right). Proportions are largely consistent. Some openings/door details appear simplified (doors not fully modeled with swings).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present in the correct rooms: dining table/chairs, bed, living seating, kitchen counters/appliances, and bathroom fixtures. Minor simplification in some elements.

visual_clarity.notes: Readable walls/floors with coherent materials and no obvious mesh breakage. Lighting is adequate. Text labels are present in the 3D view, reducing presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Camera angle is very close to top-down, reducing visible wall side faces and the strength of 3D depth cues.
Door/opening representation is simplified; not all door geometries/swings from the 2D plan are explicitly modeled.
Room text labels appear in the 3D render, lowering presentation quality.

summary: A true 3D cutaway model with strong layout fidelity to the 2D plan, slightly weakened by the near top-down camera and simplified door/opening detailing.
